We’re especially interested in speaking with candidates who have experience with Facebook, Amazon, Netflix and Google- the aptly named FANG companies - and their advanced technologies to acquire and retain users. Certifications in these areas are always preferred (PMP, Prosci, Lean Six Sigma, etc.).

This is an opportunity to join a rapidly growing team in the Bay Area that serves some of the most exciting and highly respected businesses in the world. You will have the opportunity to provide clients with original thinking and customized solutions and you’ll often have the satisfaction of seeing the impact of your work on the business. We are particularly committed to a healthy work-life integration.

Consulting / Agency experience
Academic successes
Data supported success stories
High impact work product
Cross-functional experience
Growth from failure
Innovation and initiative
Powers of persuasion

The Trium Group is hiring talented and experienced management consultants to join our San Francisco Office. Our culture encourages a deeply thoughtful mixture of personal and professional development as we lead our clients on a journey that changes them and their companies in a deep and permanent way.

Come work in an environment that will put you in front of the world’s most powerful business leaders, challenge you to continually develop professionally and personally, and put you on the front lines of the most transformative business consulting work in the world.

If you are looking for a place where you can make a huge impact, where each member of the team is constantly bringing their A-game, and where you will be perpetually challenged to punch above your weight, The Trium Group is the place for you.

What we are looking for:


We are seeking a Manager to help realize our mission to change the world by changing the way business leaders think. This is a rare opportunity to engage in the traditional management consulting practice of defining and implementing strategy while focusing deeply on the human dynamics that go into long term business success.

This role is based out of the Jackson Square neighborhood in San Francisco. This is a particularly exciting point in Trium history because we are at an intersection of 20 years of very successful client engagements and thought leadership but are also experiencing a growth trajectory that is reminiscent of a newly formed company. We have a need for high-energy, forward-focused, experienced business leaders to drive this increasingly important work. If you are looking to increase your impact and can describe yourself in the following way, you might want to take a closer look at this opportunity:
7+ years’ experience including a mix of management consulting, in-house strategy work, and business school
A practiced business professional with leadership experience and a passion for management consulting
A strong orientation for business, but with an increasing awareness that the most powerful business leaders seek insights that go beyond traditional business measures
Why you will really love this opportunity:
You are an over-achiever who typically gravitates to both formal and informal leadership
You are an experienced Management Consultant who has come to recognize the fallacy of most traditional consulting practices and how they fail to address the internal drivers enabling really powerful leadership
You take a deeply curious approach to your development practice and understand the value of integrating that with your consulting work
The Role


You will have essential responsibility to meet with top-tier business leaders, diagnose organizational health, define and communicate strategic vision, lead engagements, and have a significant hand in firm leadership. This role centers around the following responsibilities:
Diagnose root challenges and distill qualitative and quantitative data into meaningful insights
Communicate with clients to understand their system more clearly, the issues they face, and the mindsets and behaviors that will support their transformative vision
Structure, frame, and solve complex organizational and execution problems
Work with a team to diagnosis problems, design interactive client experiences and facilitate client interactions ranging from project check-ins to breakout groups or large off-sites
Provide thought leadership around the research, development, and implementation practices of Trium intellectual property
Influence the business development pipeline through the growth and maintenance of strong client relationships
Play a meaningful role in firm leadership by enabling professional development, mentoring, team leadership, and recruiting
Collaborate, partner, and pitch in; Everyone on the Trium project team, regardless of position, title, or experience, is fully accountable for helping our clients successfully achieve a set of outcomes
The Ideal Person
Background requirements
Possesses an MBA from a top-tier school
Has direct experience as a management consultant
Has 3+ years of leadership experience and a track record of delivering results
Excellent grasp of business strategy PLUS organizational and leadership issues
Exceptional communication, presentation, facilitation, and interpersonal skills
Ability to travel occasionally
What makes a good Trium Manager?
The belief that work should be about doing something awesome and fulfilling.
Passionate about helping leaders build healthy, high performing organizations
Worked in traditional management consulting but found the outside-in approach to be un-inspiring and oftentimes ineffective. (e.g., we know all the answers)
Worked in an operating role at the types of companies we serve and have come to appreciate the holistic nature of leadership, culture, and strategy and the role they play in building high-performing organizations
Shows up with gravitas, confidence, and a relatable personality
Possesses a responsible mindset with the ability to self-reflect and adjust accordingly
Strong character with a passion for self-discovery and personal development
Understands the connection between strong organizational performance, human relationships, and individual mindset
The Company


The Trium Group is a west coast-based management consulting firm that helps organizations solve their most complex strategic, operational, cultural and leadership challenges. Trium delivers its work with a unique, higher-level mission: to change the world by changing the way business leaders think. Since it was founded in 1998, Trium has served more than 150 leading global companies including Activision, Barclays Global Investors, Cisco, Dropbox, GE, Gap, Genentech, Lululemon, McKesson, NetApp, SAP, Sephora, StubHub, VMware, and Virgin Atlantic Airways.

Job description

Applied Value offers the Consultant the opportunity to work directly with managers and partners and contribute to all aspects of case analysis, strategy development, presentation, and implementation.

The Consultant is a key member of the project team. The Consultant plays a vital role in interacting with and delivering results to the client.

The Consultant has a unique and exciting opportunity to work with clients that are often more entrepreneurial, innovative, and international than typical management consulting clients. Our clients range from new business ventures to established market leaders, giving the Consultant the opportunity to experience a variety of business challenges with companies at different stages of development. Applied Value also develops long term relationships with its clients, allowing the Consultant to work closely with industry experts and senior level management to ensure that the creation and delivery of its final product is always of the highest standards.

The Consultant has a high level of responsibility for gathering company and industry data, interviewing personnel, and developing and implementing key insights and recommendations. The Consultant will often be responsible for managing day-to-day scheduling and progress updates to ensure a successful engagement with the client. The Consultant, guided by his or her managers, directs research and analysis as well as structure the project approach, objective, and implementation. You are actively involved in the overall direction, quality, and success of the final presentation as well as follow up work that leads to further involvement with the client.

Applied Value offers a career path where you are expected to take a large responsibility from day one for your own work tasks or parts of the project. You are also, in an early stage of your career, expected to be a part of the sales process, which includes identifying potential clients and projects, produce sales materials, and participate in sales meetings.


Requirements

Applied Value is looking for people who share our ambitions and who can deliver results in our driven, dynamic environment. We want people who can form their own conclusions, yet can learn from others. We want people who can get things done on time. We are looking for people who bring a commercial perspective and an ability to make immediate impact.

Candidates must be decisive, results-oriented, highly motivated, and able to work in an unstructured environment. Demonstrated leadership, business acumen and financial skills, plus a willingness to travel are essential. Previous start-up, general management, engineering, sales, or marketing experience is a plus. Flexibility and drive are requirements.

The Consultant position at Applied Value requires:
1-3 years of relevant work experience, preferably within management consulting, although other relevant industry experience will be considered.
Degrees in Engineering, Business and Economics are preferred but not required.
Consultants must be fluent in English.

COMPANY SUMMARY

Acquis Consulting Group is a consulting firm specializing in strategy and implementation. We partner with clients to enable growth that is both measurable and meaningful. We help our partners create new ways to think about their business, but we don’t stop there. We see projects through and help implement business ideas, turning them into lasting business value.

Acquis serves both domestic and international organizations from our headquarters in New York City and satellite offices in California, Massachusetts and New Jersey. Acquis supports industry leading enterprises through high profile projects that span strategy and execution.

COMPANY CULTURE

We sustain our culture through careful analysis of new and experienced hires and go to great lengths to hire individuals that will add to the experience of working at Acquis. Our core values at Acquis are People First, Advance Together and Think +Do.

People First:One of our greatest priorities is to attract, develop, and retain top talent. Accordingly, we have created a “second family” environment where each individual has an opportunity and obligation to contribute to our shared success. We measure this success not only through our delivery excellence but through the satisfaction of the people that work here. We believe that we have created a unique environment that balances autonomy with responsibility, offering the ability to learn by doing while providing a careful balance of oversight. Acquis is a learning organization that is built on the premise that our employees can add value from day one.

Advance Together: Acquis brings insight, passion, and intelligence to the lasting relationships we establish with leading enterprises. We measure ourselves through our clients’ success utilizing the agility, creativity, and focus of a smaller firm.

Think+Do: Acquis provides our clients with strategic insights and also helps deliver them. Acquis consultants can advise our clients on their critical business issues, develop creative ways to address their challenges, and help implement these solutions.

POSITION OVERVIEW

Acquis Consulting Group is seeking a few intelligent and skilled consultants with 2 – 4 years’ experience to act as Associates. A BS or BA is required for consideration, concentration in business preferred. Top schools, impressive GPAs and challenging curriculum will receive preference.

Candidates must be self-starters with proven positions of leadership. Mental agility and the ability to learn are paramount. The ability to take on new challenges and succeed beyond one’s comfort zone is required.

SCOPE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Acts as an incisive, effective creative thinker bringing business and consulting experience to client engagements and applies expert skills in communication, research, problem-solving, and analysis to the hands-on work that is the primary focus of these positions.
Takes on significant responsibilities, working closely with clients and making a major contribution to every engagement.
Leverages business context to analyze and improve complex business models.
Explains and reviews analysis/findings with team members and client personnel.
Assesses presenting problem with appropriate project scope and decomposes problem to identify root causes.
Manages client expectations and project scope actively with an approach designed to engender project success and extend goodwill.
Identifies implications of proposed solutions on people, processes, technology, strategy and structure.
Builds an effective business case for proposed solutions.
Thrives in an entrepreneurial, results-oriented, small business environment.
EDUCATION
BS or BA (Business, Finance, Engineering, Computer Sciences preferred)
MBA is not required, but MBAs from top schools preferred
SKILL SET AND EXPERIENCE

Preferred consulting backgrounds include but are not limited to:
Capability Development
Cost Management and Reduction
New Product and Service Development
Post-Merger Integration
Procurement
Shared Services
Travel, Expense and Meetings
Preferred skill sets include but are not limited to:
Analytics and Reporting
Change Management
Operational Strategy
Process Engineering
Program and Project Management
Systems Implementation
PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES
Well-rounded – You have a wide range of skills, interests, and an exceptional work ethic.
Positive – No job is too big or too small for you. You take your work seriously, but you don’t take yourself too seriously.
Adaptive – You enjoy being outside of your comfort zone. You tackle ambiguity, change, and new challenges with enthusiasm.
Quick-learning –You have the mental agility to self-start and succeed in a fast-paced environment.
Analytical – You have a passion for data-driven problem solving.
Results-oriented – You do what it takes to get the job done right and have the fortitude to see it through.
Customer-focused – You are passionate about the success of your client.
Collaborative – You’re the consummate team player, and everyone wants to be on your team.

Celonis disrupted what had previously been a manual, time-consuming and expensive consulting-driven approach to jump-start and operationalize change in transformation initiatives. Companies around the world including Siemens, L'Oreal, Uber, 3M, Lufthansa and Vodafone rely on Celonis technology to guide action and drive change to business processes, resulting in millions of dollars saved and an improved experience for their customers. Headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York, New York, Celonis has grown 5,000% in 4 years and 300% in the past year. In 2019, Celonis reached a $2.5 billion valuation, after receiving a $290 million Series C funding round. Since opening its US headquarters in New York in September 2016 it has quickly added blue chip customers like Lockheed Martin, ExxonMobil, Honeywell, and Mars to its client roster. The US is the fastest growing region for Celonis and will soon exceed 50% of its total revenue. In addition to its offices in the UK, Netherlands, and Japan, Celonis is expanding US offices in New York, San Francisco, Raleigh, Ann Arbor, as well as Latin America.

Drive a top deals/account program with sales teams to define the Account/Deal Strategy that will result in substantial opportunities for Celonis; prioritize sales initiatives to pursue based on pain points

You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. RSM is a place where you are valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments and potential. Experience RSM US. Experience the power of being understood.

RSM is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans.

CORE BUSINESS OPERATIONS

Core Business Operations (CBO) is an integrated set of offerings that addresses our clients' core business issues. CBO provides a gamut of consulting services spanning advisory, implementation and operations. CBO practitioners help our clients transform, modernize, and run their existing technology platforms right from process design to implementation and finally ensuring roll-out transition.

CBO has four different offerings — Systems Engineering focused on design, delivery and support of large scale software applications and integrated systems; Cloud Engineering focused on end-to-end cloud services from migration strategy into transformation and cloud operations; Core Industry Solutions focused on industry vertical, sector specific solutions that drive operational change and automate the core of the business; and Operations Transformation focused on creating a flexible, innovative business model for clients supported by a strong operations foundation. CBO serves clients across Life Sciences and Health Care, Government & Public Services and Financial Services among other industries.

SYSTEMS ENGINEERING

At Deloitte Consulting LLP, our Systems Engineering specialists help clients manage the complexity inherent with technology change, from requirements planning to architecture, testing to deployment, and beyond, helping to link their IT programs to organizational goals. And we offer a complete range of industry-leading services, including systems development, solution and platform integration. Learn more about our Systems Engineering practice.

SENIOR CONSULTANT

As a Senior Consultant at Deloitte Consulting, you will be responsible for leading the design, development and deployment of large-scale complex software solutions at an enterprise level. These applications are often high-volume mission critical systems and would provide you an exposure to a broad range of technologies across all layers of architecture in the Java J2EE technology stack. You will be responsible for independently lead the team and mentor junior team members, collaborating team across shores to understand the functional requirements and translate them into work products. You will be involved in end-to-end delivery of the project from estimations, planning and execution. You would also be responsible for tracking status and collecting metrics for analysis.

Work you’ll do
• Lead and drive discussions with business and functional analysts and come up with technical architecture and design and help the team shape requirements and resolve ambiguities.
• Understand the impacts of adapting different architectures and designs and present the same to all relevant stakeholders. Manage both functional and technical requirements while deciding on technical solutions.
• Develop solutions following established technical design, application development standards and quality processes in projects.
• Manage project execution by defining the work-breakdown structure in accordance with the master project plan and track the progress.
• Establish technical design / development guidelines, templates and standards and ensure that the team follows them.
• Run the daily calls / scrum meetings with respect to deliverables and build the weekly status reports to be reviewed with leadership.
• Perform detailed reviews on deliverables. Provide technical guidance to the team members.
• Interact with other stakeholders not limited to end-user clients, Project Manager/Scrum master, Business Analysts, offshore development, testing and other cross-functional teams.

The team
CBO practitioners work on design, delivery and support of a variety of solutions that help our clients meet business objectives. These solutions range from large scale ground-up custom developed applications, to cloud based development and integration services as well as customizing industry sector focused packages. As a Java/J2EE capability hire on this team, you would get opportunities to work on all adjacent area technologies such as user interface/user experience development, integration services, business rules engine solutions, or cloud based service.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

Prior Experience:
7 to 10 years of hands on technical experience on web / application development using Java / JEE technology stack.

Skills / Project Experience - required:
• Strong conceptual knowledge in OOPS, Core Java, Collections, Multithreading.
• Experience on Web Technologies JSP, Servlets.
• Experience with working on any one of the web frameworks: Spring, Struts etc. and on data access frameworks like JDBC, Hibernate etc.
• Experience on web/application servers (Tomcat, Jboss etc.).
• Experience with webservice development (SOAP / REST)
• Experience on any of the JMS/Messaging tools like Apache ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ, Message Brokers, Kafka, etc.
• Ability to write build/configuration scripts using Build tools (Ant, Maven and scripting) and code configuration tools (Subversion, Github, Perforce etc.).
• Experience with UML (Class, Sequence, Domain Model) and on various design patterns
• Ability to work with automated unit test frameworks like Junit and drive end-to-end testing of modules.
• Ability to write SQL with complex joins on RDBMS and usage of database functions or unstructured databases like MongoDB
• Ability to communicate clearly across teams in the project and having excellent verbal and written communication skills for articulating architecture and design principles.
• Experience managing medium size teams

• Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Skills / Project Experience - good to have:
• Experience with Micro services development using spring boot or any other technology framework.
• Experience on Agile/Scrum based delivery.
• Experience in different architectural designs for complex enterprises.
• Industry recognized Technology Certification.
• Travel at 80% (While 80% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.

Deloitte’s culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship

NerdWallet is seeking a data-driven and analytical professional for our Data Analytics team. This individual will focus on providing digital data solutions and innovations to help grow our business. Successful candidates will partner with Marketing teams to uncover data-driven insights, and will be expected to understand and contribute to all aspects of NerdWallet's data. Ideal candidates will be passionate, flexible and interested in the power of FinTech to improve consumers' lives. We are looking for analytical nerds across multiple levels from Analyst to Senior Analyst, so if you feel like this is an exciting opportunity we would love to hear from you.

Where you can make an impact:
Be a NerdWallet Marketing data expert: know the ins and outs of our database, consisting of both internal and third party data, including availability, provenance, reliability and relationships between data sets. Through SQL, you will process, transform, merge and report our data.
Drive highly visible analytic projects for NerdWallet CRM & Marketing such as multivariate testing, attribution modeling, and media mix modeling.
Partner with marketing and CRM to understand business strategy, challenges and goals, and discover areas for opportunity.
Develop and optimize methodologies to measure effectiveness of campaigns across multiple channels like SEM, Social, OTT, TV, OOH, Native and Email.
Deliver deep-dive analyses of mid- or post-campaign performance as well as ad-hoc requests to put forward hypotheses and recommendations for future initiatives and programs.
Serve as a leader in defining metric calculations; partner with BI Engineers on development of self-serve dashboards to monitor KPIs and success metrics.
Collaborate cross-functionally with sister analytics teams at NerdWallet to leverage shared platforms, best practices, insights and innovations.
Surface insights and present results to business leaders using a variety of tools – Tableau/Looker, Office Suite slides, spreadsheets, etc.
You are:


Highly productive: Work independently on a day-to-day basis. This role is intended for somebody who will take meaningful responsibility and initiative for our business metrics.
Structured thinker: Understand the key drivers to our business and identify how to modify them to improve business metrics.
Consumer-first and positive thinker: You're motivated to work hard in a fast-paced environment – business decisions here can connect and impact millions of users.
Expert multi-tasker and prioritizer: Experience (and preferably an enjoyment of) balancing numerous different priorities and demands.
Positive and adaptable: Demonstrates flexibility and constructive attitude in face of shifting business needs and personal responsibilities
Your experience:


Day-to-day familiarity with writing efficient SQL to solve complex problems and manipulate big data sets (SQL experience required, experience with Python or other scripting languages is a plus)
Solid understanding of multivariate testing, attribution modeling, media mix modeling, lift analysis, and customer segmentation highly preferred
Strong communication skills and the ability to explain complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Looker, Qlikview, etc.), CRM, and marketing automation platform
2 - 4+ years of experience in a quantitative role, preferably at a consumer technology company
BA/BS degree, Masters a plus- preferably in a quantitative field like Math, Statistics, or Economics
What we offer:


Work hard, stay balanced (Life's a series of balancing acts, eh?)
100% paid premiums for medical, dental and vision for employees and their dependents
Rejuvenation Policy – Flexible Time Off + 12 holidays
New Parent Leave for employees with a newborn child or a child placed with them for adoption or foster care
Mental health support through Ginger.io
Paid sabbatical for Nerds to recharge, gain knowledge and pursue their interests
Health and Dependent Care FSA and HSA with monthly NerdWallet contribution
Weekly Virtual Bootcamp, Yoga and Mindfulness Meditation sessions
Monthly Wellness Stipend and Cell Phone Stipend
Have some fun! (Nerds are fun, too)
Nerd-led group initiatives – Intramural Sports, Employee Resource Groups for Parents, Diversity and Inclusion, Womxn, LGBTQIA, and other communities
Hackathons, Happy Hours and team bonding across all teams and departments
Company-wide events like Little Nerds Day (aka bring your kids to work day, even if you're remote!) and our annual Charity Auction
Lifestyle (Be your best self - we'll take care of the details)
Our Nerds love to make an impact by paying it forward – Donate to your favorite causes with a company match
Work from home equipment stipend and co-working space subsidy
Commuting stipend and catered breakfast, lunch and onsite barista for SF based Nerds
Anniversary recognition program – choose from different items and experiences
Plan for your future (And when you retire on your island, remember the little people)
401K with company match
Annual Enrichment Stipend for learning and development
Be the first to test and benefit from our new financial products and tools
Access to Rocket Lawyer for online legal support and resources
NerdWallet is committed to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Job Description

Continental Western Corporation is a nationwide supplier of packaging, safety, and industrial supplies. Through our group of companies, we are proud of our success in providing quality products, outstanding customer service, and prompt delivery to our thousands of customers. We are also proud and appreciative of our many dedicated employees and many have been with us for over 20 years.

CWC is seeking an experienced marketing manager to help create, develop, execute and manage omni-channel marketing strategies including web marketing, email, social media, trade shows, PR and other sources to drive traffic and generate sales at CWC.

You will help create the strategy and execution of online advertising, PPC strategy, SEO, and other online channels. You've optimized Google Ad other ad campaigns for years, have a sharp mind for metrics, and a keen insight into customer conversion. You should be comfortable crafting campaigns from the high-level strategy down to detailed execution and be able to constantly come up with new ideas. You will take initiative, measure results and learn quickly, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Specific Duties, Activities & Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

• Work with stakeholders to develop and execute customer and market-facing plans, campaigns, materials, and events to support product and sales revenue goals and other marketing milestones.

• Develop and steward the various CWC corporate and product brands in alignment with stakeholders on branding, messaging, and content.

• Plan, develop and manage online, event , and print promotional campaigns in line with marketing objectives.

• Brainstrorm new and creative digital and print campaigns that engage, inform and motivate.

• Responsibility for product brand management.

• Collaborate, negotiate, and work directly with design agencies and other vendor partners.

• Monitor and report on effectiveness of marketing communications.

• Maintain effective internal communications to ensure that the company is kept informed of marketing objectives.

• Create and manage budgets associated with each of the various marketing activities.

• Helping manage and optimize demand generating functions for new CWC customers and products.

• Responsible for managing and creating visual branding.

• Identify opportunities for organizational process improvements.

• Collaborate with management and sales to implement new product lines and product improvements based on market feedback.

• Create content and collaborate with designers to support marketing efforts including press releases, white papers, brochures, email announcements and videos.

• Measure and validate campaign effectiveness and ROI in addition to SEO and SEM results.

Qualifications:

• Bachelor's Degree or higher

• 2+ years of previous marketing experience

• Excellent data analytics skills.

• Passionate about marketing!

• Native English speaking level.

• Strong visual orientation and communication skills.

• Background in B2B marketing.

• Strong computer skills.

• Some web design experience a plus.

• Experience managing marketing campaigns across multiple mediums.

• Adaptability to new challenges and environments.

• Self-starter who can develop and enact effective processes to streamline tasks.

• A curiosity for technology and learning new things.

Continental Western Corporation offers a competitive benefits package including 100% employer paid medical and dental insurance for employees, 401(k) with 3% employer match, profit sharing, paid vacation, paid sick time and more.Compensation and benefits are commensurate with skill & experience level.

PERFORMANCE MARKETING MANAGER*
VICI is an e-commerce start-up that sells quality, affordable, on-trend clothing for the contemporary woman. Established in 2012, VICI has experienced over 200% growth in the past two years from 50 to over 250 employees. The VICI brand has a strong e-commerce presence and sells 90% of its product online, which is shipped from its corporate warehouse located in Concord, CA.

VICI’s brand was created based on trends the founders saw after the 2009 recession. Consumers were becoming cautious about spending, yet women’s desire for affordable fashion remained. What sets VICI apart is an unwavering commitment to customer service and a zeal for social media marketing. Posting 20 new looks each day on Instagram and Facebook, women are consistently inspired to create their own personal style through looks from VICI’s brand.

VICI’s tremendous growth can be traced back to the talented individuals that have joined our company over the years. We are now seeking a talented Performance Marketing Manager to join our e-commerce team to help shape all foundational marketing programs for VICI.
POSITION SUMMARY: *
The Performance Marketing Manager will be responsible for managing key paid acquisition channels. Reporting into the company Vice President, this position is responsible for executing plans that drive scalable and sustainable growth, in line with the company’s business goals.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: *
· Manage key user acquisition channels, which include Facebook, Shopping, Pinterest and other channels in the future.

· Own channels end to end, including: setting up and optimizing campaigns, managing creative, measuring campaign performance to derive insights to inform future campaigns, and more.

· Oversee campaign budgets to ensure monthly budget allocations, while maintaining overall CAC and CPA targets.

· Design and analyze channel level experiments utilizing platform tools to run a/b tests for creative, copy, and landing pages.

· Maintain reporting dashboards and share out performance metrics with leadership to provide visibility into channel level performance.

· Work directly with Facebook and Google representatives to keep up to date on best practices and test new platform features.
Qualifications & Experience: *
· Bachelor’s degree in related field required.

· 3+ years of acquisition marketing experience

· Experience with Facebook Ads required; familiarity with Google Shopping and other platforms a plus.

· Knowledge of ad copy and creative best practices for Facebook and other paid channels.

· Solid working experience with Excel and Google Sheets.

· Strong strategic, analytical and problem-solving skills

· Working technical knowledge of pixels and data feeds.

· Ability to thrive in a fast-moving, startup environment

· The ideal candidate has e-commerce experience running campaigns on both Facebook and Google. This person should be analytical, detail oriented, flexible and comfortable in a fast paced and collaborative environment.

· Excellent verbal and written communication and strong customer service skills.

Who We Are:

Grabango is the leading provider of checkout-free shopper technology for existing stores. Founded by Will Glaser (technology founder of Pandora Media), the Grabango team has developed the only enterprise class solution for large store chains in the market today. Grabango's system accommodates thousands of store locations, hundreds of thousands of SKUs and millions of square feet across a given retail enterprise.

We're a growing group of kind, curious, self-directed people working towards a common goal. We delight in taking risks and testing hypotheses in a collaborative and supportive environment. Our ability to celebrate both our successes and failures as milestones of growth opens the door to tremendous breakthroughs.

Computer vision and machine learning are at the core of our patent pending technology. Our accomplished team is a powerful combination of technology and commerce professionals that are working to “Eliminate lines and save people time!”

Overview:

The Marketing Specialist will help develop, execute, and monitor marketing programs across a variety of channels. Their work includes researching the market, analyzing trends to help define the organization's marketing strategy, and developing targeted marketing programs to support Grabango’s clients. The Marketing Specialist will also help with the coordination of events and marketing projects. The Marketing Specialist will need to have great communication, project management skills, and an ability to analyze data and identify trends. The right candidate will be eager to wear multiple hats with the ability to perform in a fast-paced environment. This full-time role reports directly to the Sr. Marketing Manager
What you'll be doing:
Develop, implement, and track marketing programs such as email, social media, or digital campaigns, and events
Collaborate with other internal teams (e.g. product and sales) to develop and monitor strategic marketing initiatives
Analyze and report on the performance and efficiency of campaigns
Conduct market research and analyze trends to identify new marketing opportunities
Develop and create marketing materials, such as sales and product collateral, and ensure brand guidelines are met
Write, proofread, and edit creative and technical content across different media
Work with external agencies and vendors to execute marketing programs
What you should have:
1-3 years of experience in marketing, B2B2C experience preferred
Strong knowledge of various marketing and analytics tools such as Hubspot, Google Analytics, Wordpress, Asana or similar, CRM systems, and content management systems
Excellent analytical skills and a knack for data analysis
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Skilled in writing and editing content with an attention to detail
Strong prioritization, organization, and project management skills
Ability to travel as necessary
Education & Certifications:
Bachelor's degree in business administration, marketing, communications, or a related field
Grabango Values:
Integrity: Do the right thing, particularly when you don’t have to.
Bold Innovation: Think recklessly, but temper your actions with pragmatism.
Execution Matters: Hire the best people, and treasure them.
Don’t Live with Broken: Have the courage to admit mistakes, and the urgency to correct them.
Customer Focus: Delight customers, both internal and external.
Simplify: Enough Said.

Grabango is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to developing a workplace where diversity and inclusion are an essential part of who we are. We strive to hire and support a workforce as diverse as our shopper base, so we can develop products and services that best suit our customers. We do not make employment decisions based on race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status and we comply with all local, state and federal employment laws.

Grabango participates in the E-Verify Program, an internet-based system operated by the Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration. It allows employers to confirm an individual’s employment eligibility to work in the United States.

The Growth Marketing Manager role is focused on delivering scalable impact through full-funnel acquisition, retention strategy, execution, effective platforms and rigorous growth analytics.

As a Growth Marketing Manager, you will help us convert new audiences by creating scalable programs, including freemium experiences that build loyalty and viral loops that extend our reach.

You thrive on experimentation, and constantly seek out ways to improve the trajectory of business metrics. You love and are extremely adept at creating new content and testing emails, copy, language, messaging to improve overall conversion metrics.

You will be driven, and nimble enough to work in a rapidly changing industry, tolerate ambiguity, lead cross-functional teams through influence, and demonstrate problem-solving leadership.

You reach for data first, but when there is none available, you have a bias toward action and come up with a strategic plan to get it done. You geek out on A/B testing, site optimization, conversion rates, and above all else care deeply about the customer.

Qualifications:

The Growth Marketing Manager will analyze sales & product performance and will execute digital strategies for product demand, continuous online growth, and customer management. The ideal candidate is highly experienced in leading the development and implementation of e-commerce sales, digital marketing strategies, email nurturing, and best practices.
BA / BS with 5-10 years of progressive experience in B2B and B2C e-commerce and marketing
Proven depth knowledge in digital marketing and technology
Passion for nurturing prospects through their journey, tracking and optimizing their digital experience across every touchpoint and marketing channel, establishing & producing content and email campaigns mapped to buyers journey, and scaling lead nurturing and conversion through software and digital approaches
Experience supporting sales teams to close new and cross-sell business
Experience in developing, writing, and producing product tutorials, articles, templates, and other content that increase adoption
Obsession over impact and results; can back decisions with data and are able to tie campaign results to company impact
Experience in optimizing marketing automation workflows and triggers to help drive an efficient, low-touch sales process
Understanding of how to drive high product adoption rates and an effective upgrade path
Experience working cross-functionally with creatives, Marketing, Sales, Engineering, and product managers
Excellent written, verbal, and visual communication skills with attention to detail
Demonstrable problem-solving skills and ability to manage complex, cross-functional projects to completion
Ambition with a growth mindset and an ability to lead projects with a high level of autonomy
Proficiency in HubSpot and Salesforce
This position can be remote from any location with occasional travel (drive or fly) to the office.

Totango is the leader in the Customer Success software as a service space. Our platform is used by some of the biggest enterprise and hottest SaaS companies to understand and influence their own customer engagement, to manage customer success, as well as to monitor and predict customer health. We are passionate about building technology that helps companies make their customers happy, reduces churn, and optimize revenue growth.

We offer competitive salary, great benefits, and you'd be joining an awesome, collaborative, open office culture. If you know you're the right candidate, we would love to hear from you!

About Nitro:

Nitro is a global document productivity company. We help organizations of all sizes eliminate paper, accelerate business processes, and drive digital transformation by providing PDF productivity and eSigning for all in a single, affordable solution. Founded in 2005 in Melbourne, Australia, Nitro helps increase efficiency for more than 10,000 businesses globally, including 65% of the 2019 Fortune 500. Nitro headquarters are in San Francisco, with offices in Dublin, London, and Melbourne. Accomplish more with documents and make work more productive at GoNitro.com.

We’re here to create a safer, happier and more mindful future for all with the help of data science, engineering, design, and mobile technology. We're starting by reinventing insurance, by rethinking the technologies that enable it, but our true goal is to build a platform that rewards people for driving well — creating safer roads with fewer accidents in the process.

Backed by impressive funding, we're poised to re-engineer a trillion-dollar category, and that’s just the beginning. We’re using rich customer insights, advanced technology and data science to build our cloud-native InsurTech solution, and other things we haven’t even dreamt up yet. We're out to change behavior and promote mindful living at a societal level. But the key to us being successful in our mission isn’t just about nailing the technology—it’s about hiring the talented people who can help us make a quantifiable impact in the world. We’re growing our world-class team.

And that’s where you come in.

The Role
The Sr. Lifecycle Marketing Specialist helps plan strategic communications and data-driven campaigns across channels and key touch points, including email, push notifications, SMS, and direct mail. Your role is responsible for the continuous enhancement of our email campaigns and customer comms to drive growth, activation, and increase customer relationships and loyalty while partnering closely with marketing and product teams across growth initiatives.

Working within the cross-discipline growth team, you will be responsible for planning, executing, analyzing and optimizing lifecycle strategies while serving as a subject matter expert for omni-channel communication. With an orientation around our target customer experience and generating measurable engagements that drive short and long-term business results. The ideal candidate has a data-driven analytical mindset, a passion for understanding the customer journey, and has worked on complex lifecycle and nurture programs.
About You:
You’ve travelled many roads within the marketing practice—from retail to ecommerce and SaaS start-ups—delivered results and helped grow a profitable customer base and kept them engaged with strategic and experimental growth tactics. But you’re not one to rest on your laurels or driven by an ego. Instead, your passion for your craft, curious mind, and desire to see your team succeed fuels a broad interest in marketing that delivers results.
You have an entrepreneurial spirit and thrive on helping shape capabilities within a growing business. And you can leverage all your passion and acumen to deliver results with your team — be it email campaigns that promote organic referrals or build personalized nurturing journeys that convert. When it comes to the brand and customer, you understand these impact our success as much as business optimization.

Key Qualities:

You’re a hybrid with a passion for performance-driven marketing and branding. You understand that creating great marketing requires experimentation and meaningful measurement to achieve business results. But you’re also a master of the marketing craft, understanding the brand, the industry and what drives purchase decisions—and ultimately acquires great customers with high LTV. Whether extending brand campaigns through communication channels or working with research teams to interpret performance results, you know firsthand how to bridge the gap between a business strategy and building a community of engaged and passionate customers. Which you’ve done repeatedly. And you know that it takes teamwork to do it successfully.
You're a fantastic communicator with strong technical acumen. Both within your team, and without, you have to be able to give voice to your vision, and present your ideas effectively and objectively. And you’re ready to listen and learn too. Importantly, you understand how to take an idea and implement it, because you have extensive knowledge of ESP and CRM platforms. One moment you’re teaching the team how to create CTAs that convert and the next you’re optimizing email templates for automated email nurturing journeys.
You're a low ego collaborator and competent leader. You understand that without a multidisciplinary team to give campaigns life, an idea is worthless. You understand how to bring the creative team and technical team together to work seamlessly as a well-oiled optimized marketing machine, because you are as much a conductor as a collaborator. You also recognize the need to take a particular path, as you understand what the data is telling us and can guide the team toward optimized results.
You work with energy and passion for your craft. Branding, technology and the analytics space are your lifeblood and you inspire your teammates and compel them to produce performance driven marketing. You want to work where you can help shape the culture and have the ability to build something with a group of like-minded individuals that share your passion.
You experiment strategically. You have the ability to deliver great work that also delivers on customer and business needs. You know from experience that being intentional with your approach and experimentation goes much further than random tests for the sake of testing. And you find optimizations that generate results that acquire, retain, upsell and cross-sell customers at the right moment in the lifecycle.
You keep it together. You’re a master housekeeper—organized, methodical and timely. That’s how you stay on top of everything. Specifically, you need to be able to map the engagement into a plan that the team can implement, measure and produce extraordinary results.
You’re an entrepreneur. And with an entrepreneurial spirit, you’re a confident self-starter that has a passion for growing teams, evolving processes, and most importantly culture. In other words, you don’t want to just be a part of the culture, you want to help make it. You recognize that great company cultures come from you and your teammates, your positive attitudes and hard work to shape and nurture healthy and successful companies.

Responsibilities:

Own the planning and execution of lifecycle marketing initiatives across all channels from overall strategy and calendaring to day-to-day management including comms ideation, list management, campaign set-up, execution and analysis.
Develop data-driven customer segmentation strategies that enable us to drive higher conversion for prospective customers and engagement among existing customers across the lifecycle using email, push notifications, SMS and direct mail.
Drive optimization and growth experimentation process to hypothesize, prioritize, and execute A/B and multivariate tests to drive core KPIs and gain further insights into customer behavior.
Define, execute, and optimize lifecycle management campaigns (e.g. saved quote nurturing, new user onboarding, etc).
Work closely with the broader Growth team and agency partners on coordinated integrated marketing campaigns and comms across outbound and inbound channels.
Help with budgeting, forecasting and reporting process for all segments, email cadence, including monthly/weekly/daily forecasting reporting at a channel level for traffic, revenue, spend and other performance KPIs.
Drive and Grow Email Strategy: Responsible for segmentation, file health, forecasting, testing and overarching direction of email program. This includes optimization of daily batch & blast emails as well as developing the strategy and execution of triggered campaigns, including personalization and segmentation strategies.
Partner closely with the broader Growth team for continuous cadence of testing with audience segments across channels and touchpoints (e.g. landing page/website optimization, etc).
Help manage the customer and prospect list health, monitor deliverability, troubleshoot issues, and work closely with Data and Marketing to utilize effectively within compliance.
Work with analytics to compile and present weekly/monthly reports covering key metrics and KPIs (e.g., delivery, open rate, click thru rate, unsubs) and synthesized insights on campaign performance and overall channel performance to communicate impact.
Stay on top of emerging technologies, best practices and competitive insights to be able to provide recommendations on new technical solutions as relevant, while constantly pushing the envelope on new tactics and approaches.
Manage end-to-end execution of email campaigns, developing strategy, building, managing, analyzing, and optimizing email campaigns.
Work closely with creative to identify and implement innovative messaging to drive conversions at scale.
Strong ability and desire to communicate and collaborate cross-functionally with other practices and teams such as the Design, Product, Communications, Business, and Data teams.
Drive continuous improvement across email KPIs including deliverability, open rates, click-to-open rates, and conversion rates.
Ensure all email campaigns comply with current email best practices, CAN-SPAM, and data privacy policies.

Requirements & Qualifications:

5+ years of digital marketing experience with direct to consumer brands and products with a proven track record in driving customer acquisition and revenue growth.
You have 4+ years in email, lifecycle, loyalty or engagement marketing.
Hands on experience with email marketing/automation software such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud and CRM tools, Optimizely, Mailchimp as well as similar ESP and targeted marketing platforms.
Experience working with growth marketing frameworks, acquisition, lead nurture campaigns, and retention strategies.
Knowledge of HTML and email CSS.
Passion for email marketing and tracking best practices, industry trends, and testing the newest strategies.
Exceptional expertise with all aspects of email marketing, customer growth and analytics.
Strong proficiency in digital trends, omni-channel marketing, integrated campaigns and best practices.
Strong business acumen with ability to think strategically, collaboratively and experiment in innovative ways.
Robust quantitative skills including forecasting ability and ROI analyses with demonstrated ability to apply learnings to optimize results.
Strong proficiency in Google Analytics and other web metric systems.
Experience working with startups, young brands and products optimizing channel/market fit.

Bonus Points:

Growth marketing background with D2C brands and extensive knowledge of the ecommerce, retail and SaaS consumer spaces.

Additional Details:

Salary: We invest in first-rate people and pay top-of-market salaries for most positions, factoring in experience, talent and location. We do not offer equity.
Benefits: Medical, dental, vision, 401(k), wellness reimbursement, four weeks of vacation + six weeks of parental leave, and great work-life balance. Our office building offers on-site shower and bike stalls, and panoramic views of San Francisco.
Location: Due to COVID-19 our teams are all working remotely through 2020. We provide an in-home office set-up including laptop, monitor, ergonomic desk, chair and other items as needed
Location: Post COVID-19: San Francisco, CA near Montgomery Bart Station

Job Description


We are looking for a Marketing Operations Analyst to join our growing Go to Market Operations team to manage our marketing database maintenance programs. Your role is to help us maximize the overall health of our global marketing contact database by ensuring that it is current, complete, correct, consistent and compliant. This role will be responsible for data hygiene efforts including executing data cleansing efforts, augmentation, transformation, and normalization programs to support the execution of global marketing campaigns.

The ideal candidate possesses a blend of data analytics, marketing and operations acumen, and strong problem-solving skills. If you thrive in and enjoy a fast-paced, cross-functional environment, with a close-knit team of passionate individuals, this will be a good opportunity for you!


What you'll be doing
Manage data maintenance programs, including data cleansing, augmentation, and normalization
Develop data quality dashboards, scorecards and metrics to measure and improve marketing contact database health and quality
Audit data to identify gaps, discrepancies and duplications, then propose and build programs to reduce or eliminate those deficiencies
Liaison with cross-functional partners on data-related programs and processes
Train and support our marketing teams on data quality best practices and processes
Understand and ensure compliance in accordance with global privacy standards/laws

What you bring to the role:

2+ years of marketing or sales operations experience, preferably within a SaaS company
Familiarity with data management and transformation practices and platforms, including CDPs, ETL integrations
Experience and proficiency with data standardization and normalization concepts and practices
Experience and familiarity with Salesforce CRM and marketing automation architecture and objects
Hands-on experience with Openprise, SFDC DataLoader, DemandTools or similar is a plus!
Solid experience with Excel/Google Sheets advanced features
Project management with the ability to prioritize multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work independently and take project ownership; an ability to see what needs to be done and step up without having to be micromanaged

Our agreement with employees

DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what's right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you'll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.

The team

Our Field Sales Operations team collaborate with finance, sales and GTM strategy leadership team across the globe. We design, implement and manage balanced territories using accurate and insightful data to ensure that every sales rep has an equal chance at success and to minimize disruption or distraction caused by account ownership ambiguity. We focus to build, improve and automate upon existing processes to increase productivity. Manage efforts to clean up and improve data across systems.

This position

The Sales Operations Analyst is a detailed, adaptable problem-solver responsible for maintaining key sales Global Sales Operations processes. A successful analyst thinks critically, logically, and creatively to resolve existing issues and to develop proactive measures for potential roadblocks to the Sales & Business Development organization at large.

This position reports to the Director, Sales Operations Business Systems and COE.

Responsibilities
Assist with administering sales suite systems, including SFDC and Anaplan
Work cross-functionally with business owners to ensure changes to SFDC and other sales systems are consistent with business needs
Partner with HR, Sales managers, and business partners to identify headcount movement for new hire onboarding, termination off-boarding, promotions, and new team alignment
Quickly solve sales process pain points in the moment, while developing more efficient long-term solutions
Making strategic decisions with sales system and process leaders around sales user's data management
Leverages technology to create organization efficiencies, automation linking SFDC and reporting tools, as well as accounting systems
Continue to progress data quality efforts within enterprise systems such as Salesforce.com and other tools to ensure all end users are accessing accurate and timely data
Examples of those activities would be the following:
Place new hires into the Salesforce hierarchy
Maintain quota data with updates on new hires, transfers and promotions
Audit the user data for correctness to plan
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree
2 years of relevant work experience (Sales Operations, Finance, Sales Compensation)
Proficiency with Microsoft Office
Intermediate/advanced skills in MS Excel (VLOOKUP & Pivot Charts a must)
Preferred Qualifications
Strong organizational skills and business judgment with the ability to handle projects independently end-to-end
Experience with salesforce.com
Excellent communication and critical thinking skills to understand sales policies and processes at a company and individual sales rep level
Logical thinking
Creative problem-solving skills
Precise attention to detail
Self-starter work ethic
Sales & Business Development @ DocuSign

Our technology is transforming the way our customers live their lives and do business. Our Sales team is collaborating with customers across the globe to help them leverage our technology to change the way they do business. Our Business Development team is partnering with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world and in their industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to an individual or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our product and strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.

About DocuSign

DocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward.

Ability to thrive in a full commission/bonus sales environment

SALES COORDINATOR*
Seeking driven and motivated candidates to join our awesome sales team! We are a growing local solar and energy company in Northern California and are seeking passionate, talented, and service oriented inside sales team members. This is a great opportunity to work in a growing industry with unlimited opportunity for professional growth and success.*
As an Sales Coordinator you will be the first point of contact and internal coordinator of the Vital Energy Sales Team. The Inside Sales Rep provides a foundation for the outside sales team as well as logistical coordination for the sales department. The primary function will be to drive growth through contacting, qualifying, and scheduling sales appointments. This position is crucial to the support of our outside sales team and customer satisfaction by energizing opportunities from provided leads to final sale.

On a typical day you would: Talk with current or prospective customers through phone, email, website, or walk-in. You would also work with our outside Sales Team on proposals, presentations, reports, and data collection and provide a high level of internal support to the Energy Consultants and future customers.

Our Inside Sales Team and this role is integral to the success of our company. You are often the first point of contact and the face of the company and set the tone for the entire customer experience. It is critical that we strive to provide the highest level of service and support to our customers and sales team to make sure our projects are successful and ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Act as the main internal point of contact for Sales-related inquiries and intakes.
Contact, intake, qualify, and schedule appointments with prospective customers/leads with Energy Consultants.
Capture customer information to verify job feasibility through calls, emails, website requests, etc. Determine project eligibility by viewing job specifics and scheduling accordingly.
Conduct lead conversion and generation activities to maintain scheduling and sales goals, consistently reviewing and maintaining lead lists or opportunities and reaching out until scheduled.
Manage and monitor lead generation systems.
Provide a pleasant and supportive buying experience for customers while assertively pursuing every opportunity.
Screen and assign qualified leads to Energy Consultants by territory and expertise.
Setup jobs and update systems with all gathered customer and job info, intake sheets, and docs.
Gather utility info via intake or automated system.
Prepare and coordinate system designs, proposals, presentation folders, and final contracts for in-person and virtual site visits via print, email, and DocuSign.
Update and maintain CRM and sales trackers with current project status, info, customer and team communications docs. Regularly check in with Energy Consultants to gather current activities/status and make sure updated and complete.
Track and manage customer communications through customer support email and phone systems, CRM, website chats, etc.
Communicate with customers and team members through our CRM, website, email, email templates, and text.
Have the coachability to receive and implement technical sales and solar coaching and training.
Achieve specific calling and conversion goals.
Report-out status of projects at the sales stage or 'in the pipeline'
Assist with other areas of the business as needed (retail, sales, marketing, events)
Generate new leads for the sales team. Ex: through referral calling campaigns, promotional events, marketing campaigns, or personal networking
Skills and Qualifications:
Outgoing, positive, & detailed oriented.

Northwest Door is a premier Manufacturer of Steel, Aluminum and Custom Wood Garage Doors. We provide the building industry with high quality, innovative garage doors at competitive prices while maintaining a reputation of quality, reliability and integrity. Our customer base extends across the United States including Alaska and Hawaii. Our company owned Distribution Centers are located in Marysville, WA; Sumner, WA; Spokane, WA; Portland, OR; Boise, ID; Denver, CO; Salt Lake City, UT; and San Jose, CA.

We are currently seeking a Territory Sales Manager to join our San Jose, CA location. This position develops business opportunities in assigned territory, cultivating customers over the long-term. This position meets and exceeds sales goals with new and established customers; presents product information to and interacts with customers; and communicates product details to diverse audiences. This position reports directly to the Vice President of Sales.

This Territory Sales Manager will cover the Northern California / Western Nevada territory.

Essential Duties:

· Develop and execute territory sales plans with the goal to exceed the territory revenue, gross margin and other key financial metrics.

· Develop account plans in connection with sales management.

· Follow up on leads to qualify and pursue new sales opportunities.

· Establish key reseller partnerships within the territory to promote networking and new customer opportunities.

· Support marketing promotions and trade shows in order to develop new opportunities and organic revenue.

· Manage individual travel, entertainment and sample budget responsibly.

· Utilize tools to properly provide accurate, up to date information with regard to customer, activities, marketing initiatives and sales opportunities.

\*

Essential Job Skills and Experience: Any combination of education and experience for successful performance:

· Five years of experience in a professional sales role, specifically with experience in the garage door industry including knowledge of sales, installation, or maintenance of high speed and rolling steel doors.

· A Bachelor's degree in Sales, Business or related field.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite

· Ability to travel

· Ability to effectively communicate with customers and coworkers, understand customer and production demands; and the ability to build and maintain customer relationships.

Benefits: We offer a terrific compensation and benefits package including a company vehicle, salary plus commission, medical, dental, vision, company-paid life and long-term disability insurance, short-term disability insurance, 8 paid holidays, ample Personal Time Off (PTO), 401(k) with company match, longevity bonuses, service awards, tuition reimbursement and company events.

Northwest Door LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer with a diverse employment environment.

Northwest Door is a drug-free workplace. A pre-employment drug test must be negative regardless of whether you live, test or plan to work in an area that permits legalized use of marijuana for either medical or recreational purposes.

Our success depends on our ability to create a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment. We're committed to attracting, developing, retaining and promoting a diverse workforce. By ensuring that every Demandbase employee is able to bring a diversity of talents to work, we're increasingly capable of living out our mission and providing real insight from our products to support our customers. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and all walks of life to apply. Come grow with us at Demandbase!

The Sales Development Representative is an individual contributor role reporting directly to the Manager of Sales Development. You will play a critical role in expanding our presence in the market, and converting prospects into Demandbase Sales opportunities. Account-Based Marketing is one of the fastest growing and hottest sectors in digital marketing and you will play a key part in expanding the Demandbase presence as the pioneer and leader in this space.

As a Sales Development Representative, you will work closely with the direct sales team to ensure seamless transition of opportunities. Like any high performing team, you will be measured by opportunity generation and will be given the flexibility to create a book of business of your own. We encourage account development through outbound prospecting, social selling, networking, attending trade shows and field marketing events, and any sales activity that would contribute to expanding the Demandbase brand. You will be the first line of engagement with future customers and will have an impact on the success of Demandbase as an organization.

Due to the COVID pandemic, this role (as with all others) will be remote until the offices reopen.

What you'll be doing:
Manage high volume of daily outbound emails and calls to targeted accounts
Develop targeted call lists
Create personalized emails to engage targeted accounts
Utilize Social Selling techniques to expand network and open up new opportunities
Process unqualified inquiries to prequalified opportunities
Provide exceptional customer service to inbound inquiries
Documentation within SFDC
What we're looking for:
1+ years of lead generation experience
Bachelor's Degree strongly preferred
Experience working in SFDC a plus
Experience in relationship development and opportunity identification
Ability to learn/understand and articulate our platform solution and value propositions
Ability to quickly synthesize and put to use new information
Strong organizational and time management skills
Benefits:

Our benefits include 100% paid for Medical, Dental and Vision for you and your entire family, short-term/long-term disability, life insurance, flexible vacation policy and 401K. Due to the COVID pandemic the Demandbase offices are closed for the foreseeable future. When the office reopens, we also offer commuter benefits, free snacks, catered lunch every Friday, chair massages, weekly yoga and much more!

About Demandbase:

Demandbase is the leader in Account-Based Marketing (ABM) and an indispensable part of the B2B tech stack. The company offers the only end-to-end ABM platform that helps B2B marketers identify, engage, close and measure progress against best-fit accounts. The biggest and fastest growing companies in the world, such as Accenture, Adobe, DocuSign, GE, Salesforce and others rely on Demandbase to drive their ABM strategy and maximize their marketing performance. The company has been named to the JMP Securities list "The Hot 100: The Best Privately Held Software Companies," the Deloitte Fast 500 and named a Gartner Cool Vendor for Tech Go-To Market. In 2019, Demandbase executives authored the definitive book on ABM, Account-Based Marketing: How to Target and Engage the Companies That Will Grow Your Revenue. For more information, please visit www.demandbase.com or follow the company on Twitter @Demandbase.

Hi North Berkeley, we're Healthy Spot!

We do not make smoothies or salads, but we are a neighborhood spot for pet parents to find healthy food choices, dog grooming services, and a fun daycare for small pups. After 10 years of building happy pet communities in Los Angeles, we are so excited to be opening our first store in The City - a place where our founders called home for many years.

At Healthy Spot, team members are caregivers to four-legged friends, public educators, and role models. Pride in our work is what allows us to exceptionally serve dogs, customers, the Healthy Spot team, and our communities. We are a fast-growing company and provide our team members with multiple opportunities to learn, grow and expand their responsibilities. We also believe strongly in our core values and how they integrate into each of our positions.

Come join our team of fellow dog and cat lovers at our North Berkeley location!

What will you do?
Learn! Our experienced trainers and management team work together to train you for success. You’ll be a pet nutrition expert in no time!
Grow! We love to promote from within and have a clear path of management that develops individuals both professionally and personally.
Succeed! While using your knowledge from training, you’ll create an authentic experience for every customer and their furry best friend. You’ll work together with your team to smash your sales goals both weekly and monthly. Be ready to change lives and make a difference!
What do you need?
Well, you need to love dogs and cats … Obviously!
Previous experience in a customer service role is preferred – this is likely not your first rodeo!
And last but not least, yourself! At Healthy Spot, we create an environment where you’re encouraged to be your true self every day.
*Keep in mind, this position requires weekend availability.

Not quite what you’re looking for?

Visit our careers page for more opportunities: https://healthyspot.com/pages/careers
Healthy Spot considers qualified applicants with criminal histories.*

Job Description:
We would be nothing without our successful sales team. We’re seeking a qualified in-home sales consultant to help us sell the products and services that our customers have grown to rely on. The in-home sales consultant will have a strong understanding of the sales process, excelling at generating leads, building relationships, and closing deals. The ideal candidate will be a quick learner with strong negotiating skills, and the ability to showcase our offerings in a compelling way. Often tasked with giving presentations, attending networking events, and attending trade shows, it’s essential that our sales rep be personable and professional.
Objectives of this Role*
Represent our company’s products and services, starting with a deep and comprehensive understanding and following with consumer research to identify how our solutions meet needs
Meet weekly, monthly, and annual sales quotas through the successful implementation of sales and marketing strategies and tactics
Closer preset leads and build relationships planning and organizing daily work schedule to call on existing or potential prospects
Develop and implement territory action plan through comprehensive data analysis, and adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field
Daily and Monthly Responsibilities*
Maintain working relationships with existing clients to ensure exceptional service and identification of potential new sales opportunities
Identify appropriate prospects, go to sales appointments, make effective qualifying sales presentations, and manage sales cycle to close new business in all service categories offered
Possess in-depth product knowledge and be able to conduct demos and relay objection handling
Achieve sales goals by assessing current client needs and following an defined selling process with potential buyers, often utilizing product demos and presentations
Coordinate with sales management to ensure company quotas and standards are being met, performing market research and regular competitor monitoring
Skills and Qualifications*
2+ years experience in a similar sales position
Excellent communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, and organizational skills
Proficiency with sales management software and CRM
Personal integrity
Ability to travel at least 55% of the time to customer appointments
Preferred Qualifications*
Bachelor’s degree
Proven success rate at levels above quotas
Ability to balance persuasion with professionalism
Strong organizational skills
