Job Description: Sales Support Agent*
(International) *
Company Information*
VoloAgri® is a Non-GMO vegetable seed technology and breeding company dedicated to Cultivating Global Health. We take pride in passionately serving every customer with customized vegetable seed and technical service solutions they can count on. Our innovative seeds produce plants with increased yields, improved disease resistance, and post-harvest processing advantages while still achieving exceptional taste! This reduces the environmental farming footprint while increasing the healthy consumption of delicious vegetables.

Our diverse team of industry experts are stationed around the world. Our Global Corporate Headquarters is based in Woodland, CA and satellite offices in Holland, Mexico City, and Beirut Lebanon; and research stations in California (Woodland), Lebanon (Bekaa Valley), Mexico (Guanajuato, and Culiacan), and Spain (Almeria). Our prized collection of seeds have been developed under several brands including US Agriseeds, and Axia.
Location: Woodland, CA*
Position: Sales Support Agent (international) *
Reporting to: Order Fulfillment Manager *
Job Summary: *
Leads the Middle East/North Africa (MENA) or the Mexico, South/Central America regions for Order Fulfillment activities to ensure the sales order management process meets customer expectations. This process includes working directly with assigned regional Customer Service Reps in managing sales orders on inventory availability, exportation requirements, preparing and finalizing international documents and monitoring sales orders the order fulfillment process through delivery to customers.

The scope of this position includes commercial, stock seed and trial sample orders and is a hand on working lead that performs all defined tasks.
Primary Duties: *
· Leads the Order Fulfillment activities for their assigned marketing region.

o Trains, coaches and monitors performance of one direct report (Order Fulfillment Analyst) who supports the execution of daily logistics functions and tasks.

o Works closely the regions Customer Service Reps on the sales order management process once orders are entered into system.

o Conducts inventory analysis with the End Item Planner to provide an inventory availability status for each sale order line item.

· Verifies export requirements such as ADs, Country of Origin and ISTA certifications.

o Identifies inventory shortages due quantity, quality and importation constraints that impacts the order fulfillment of a sales order.

o Leads the coordination process and works closely with Procurement, Commercial and End Item Planners to source new material or upgrade inventory to fulfill the orders.

o Communicates with CSRs inventory availability issues and negotiates alternative options to maximum fulfillment (i.e. take substandard inventory “AS IS” or delay delivery until QC tests are complete or new seed lots are available).

o Provides completion dates for Process Assignments (treating/packing, etc.) to the End Item Planners based on shipping dates.

o Provides freights quotes and estimated delivery dates.

o Manages the export documentation preparation process with the Order Fulfillment Analyst to prepare, Phytos, Country of Origin, Chamber of Commerce Seals, ISTA and other special certificates required to meet country/customer regulatory requirements

o Requests Import Permits from CSRs and verify requirements are being met.

o Monitors the order fulfillment process and communicates status to CSRs if their orders are on target for set delivery dates or if there are any delays.

o Schedule the USDA Phyto inspectors to inspect shipment once the orders are picked and packed.

o Creates deliveries and invoices for customer documentation and financial reporting.

o Finalizes export documentation and ensure that they are sent by the correct mode of delivery. (i.e. DHL, Freight Forwarder, regional CSRs or directly to the customer)

o Acts as the lead coordinator between Customer Service, End Item Planners, and Packaging and Shipping departments to fulfill and ship customer orders

o Fully understand export documentation activities and functions in compliance with organizational policies, procedures, goals and objectives.

o Tracks and reports weekly status of all orders to be reviewed in weekly Operations meetings.

o Learns all aspects of the Traffic Coordinator functions and acts as backup to this position.
Qualifications & Experience: *
· A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a Logistics or similar role in a manufacturing environment

· Spanish spoken and written (business proficiency) is required

· The ideal candidate will have Supply Chain management skills

· The ideal candidate will have a background working with agricultural business or other related manufacturing operations

· The ideal candidate will have worked in a growth company & understands how to scale

· Extensive knowledge and highly proficient in the use of manufacturing databases (SAP, Oracle, ABS etc.) and Microsoft Office products

Skills and Personal Traits:

· Excellent leadership and organizational skills

· Strong analytical and computer skills

· Strong team player, self‐starter, positive attitude and high integrity

· Excellent communication skills (verbal & written) for effective vendor & internal staff communication

· Attention to detail, drives tasks to closure efficiently with error‐free end result

· Demonstrated commitment to customer satisfaction.

VoloAgri Compensation & Benefits:

· Competitive compensation package for Woodland region

· Medical & dental insurance

· Section 125 Dependent Care plans, 401(k) Plan

· Vacation, sick and holiday time off
Work Authorization**: * Must provide proof of authorization to work in the United States
Other Duties: * Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Come join us at the fastest growing coding education startup in the world! Tynker is looking for a results-focused Education Partnerships Lead. As a sales representative, you will proactively seek out and engage K-12 customer prospects and drive revenue. In this quota-carrying role you will be responsible for acquiring new leads in your territory and advancing district level adoption of Tynker.

Tynker's mission is to provide every child with solid foundations in STEM, programming and critical thinking skills to prepare them to become better architects of their future world. As the world’s largest integrated coding education platform for K-12 students, our Tynker for Schools product is used to teach students computer science and programming skills, from block coding to JavaScript, Swift, and Python. Tynker has been used by one in three U.S. K-8 schools, 90,000 schools globally and over 60 million children across 150 countries. Tynker’s partners include some of the world’s most respected brands including Apple, Microsoft, Mattel, NASA, PBS, and Lego.

Key Responsibilities:
Territory Management.
Drive revenue to achieve monthly, quarterly and annual targets.
Grow and maintain a full pipeline of prospective clients.
Maintain timely and accurate reporting of forecasts, account plans, and territory growth activities.
Build and maintain relationships with K-12 administrators, district-level decision makers & influencers.
Requirements:
5-10 years experience in Education/Enterprise/Institutional outside sales with a verifiable track record of
closing $100K+ deals.
exceeding $1M+ annual quota over multiple years
Demonstrable consultative, solution sales mindset.
Ability to work in an entrepreneurial fashion and deliver results with minimal supervision.
Excellent written/verbal communication and presentation skills for senior executive level customer engagements.
Ability to travel 10-25%, when safe and necessary.

The following are not requirements but may be plusses for your application.

Background in programming, Computer Science or similar technical field.
Additional professional experience with K-12 educational institutions, as an educator, administrator or vendor.
Being bilingual/multilingual.
